author: .paulharris
content: I've been thinking about ERA files a bit for teku, and I won't echo above. In short I think we'll be building it out, but like <@602753420033785856>, it's not something we've got a definite time on at the moment, a few balls in the air...

author: potuz
content: <@415109946682769408> the test I briefly mentioned the other day: it would be nice to test if clients have justified/finalized checkpoints and not just roots. You can have two competing chains with the same block root being a justified checkpoint but with different epochs. It would be nice to test if clients filter one of these to allow for head only descendants of the latest justified. Prysm is susceptible to have a bug here. I don't know if we have spectests for this

author: perelyn
content: How can I get started as a consensus dev? What do I read, what do I do and who do I follow?

author: lightclient
content: I recommend coming to ACD and CL call regularly to understand the overall dev context and then monitor repos for open issues to try to tackle

author: perelyn
content: Okay, thanks for the response. When are the calls held?

author: lightclient
content: you can monitor the repository https://github.com/ethereum/pm/issues
